channel.title: Jar won't load
channel.description:
So, I'm trying to make a downloadable client, I have jarmaker. So I jar it and it doesn't load, but it loads fine when I try to load it from my source and client folders... any help would be nice.
I read that it means that it can't connect to the server.... I have the ips in Loader.java on localhost.... and both the source and client are connecting to my port and I am portforwarded....
Could use some help. If you got skype add me, my name is rythegreat96
Thanks

item.title: Jar won't load
item.dc:creator: @ryz ryz
item.description:
@ryz wrote:

[quote=“iBunnie, post:8, topic:506893”][quote author=ryz link=topic=625125.msg4256100#msg4256100 date=1362791966]

So, I’m trying to make a downloadable client, I have jarmaker. So I jar it and it doesn’t load, but it loads fine when I try to load it from my source and client folders… any help would be nice.

I read that it means that it can’t connect to the server… I have the ips in Loader.java on localhost… and both the source and client are connecting to my port and I am portforwarded…

Could use some help.
If you got skype add me, my name is rythegreat96

Thanks

Are you jarring your cache while it’s in your client folder?

uhhhh… how exactly do you do that? I mean I tried it a few months ago and it worked fine… I can’t remember my settings or what I did…

I’m asking if you had your cache in your client, (not in c: drive) and then jarr’d it. Because it can’t read the cache THROUGH the .jar

my cache is in the the data folder in my server

what revision is your source/client xD

718
[/quote]
Oops, sorry i can’t help. I’m only good with 317.[/quote]

no prob. thanks anyway

Read full topic

Thanks

Are you jarring your cache while it’s in your client folder?

uhhhh… how exactly do you do that? I mean I tried it a few months ago and it worked fine… I can’t remember my settings or what I did…

I’m asking if you had your cache in your client, (not in c: drive) and then jarr’d it. Because it can’t read the cache THROUGH the .jar

my cache is in the the data folder in my server

what revision is your source/client xD
[/quote]

718[/quote]
Oops, sorry i can’t help. I’m only good with 317.
